thread.title: Harimoto youngest to reach main draw at 12, faces Ma
thread.title_full: Harimoto youngest to reach main draw at 12, faces Ma

title: Harimoto youngest to reach main draw at 12, faces Ma
text:
Harimoto youngest to reach main draw at 12, faces Ma October 24, 2015, Saturday | Print Edition 
PRECOCIOUS 12-year-old Japanese paddler Tomokazu Harimoto faces the most daunting of prospects after becoming the youngest player to qualify for the main draw of an International Table Tennis Federation world tour event. 
Harimoto, ranked 286th in the world, will take on China’s world No. 1, Olympic and world champion Ma Long in the first round of the Polish Open. Harimoto’s prize came after he beat 32-year-old Croatian Tan Ruiwu in a tight seven-game match in Warsaw on Thursday. “I won my group here, I’m happy because I won against Tan Ruiwu. If I attacked against him, everything was good but I had problem when I had to defend,” Harimoto, who started playing the game at the age of two, told the ITTF website.
